items.title: High School Diploma
items.body:
May 2003 – April 2018.

  • Achieved 96% overall in Grade 10 and 90% in the core Science track for Grade 12.
  • Served as House Prefect for two terms and represented the school in District, State, and Interschool Athletics competitions.

items.title: Bachelor of Science (Co-op), Major in Data Science
items.body:
Graduated 2025.

  • Relevant Coursework: Database Systems, Big Data, Computational Data Science, Data Structures & Algorithms, Multivariate Analysis, Statistical Learning & Prediction, Business Process Analysis, Natural Language Processing, and Time-Series Forecasting.
  • Technical Leadership: Active member of the Data Science Student Society. Organized departmental events and led live, hands-on workshops teaching advanced SQL querying and Python data manipulation to peers.

items.title: Research Analyst
items.body:
• Cleaned and preprocessed 10K+ rows of data using Python and regex, enabling faster analysis.
  • Performed sentiment analysis on medical reviews using AWS Comprehend (Python + Boto3) and exported structured results for actionable reporting.

items.title: Data Analyst (Analytics & Modeling)
items.body:
• Developed an end-to-end ML data pipeline for forecasting, integrating automated feature engineering and SMOTE balancing on 8M+ records to improve Random Forest and XGBoost ensemble accuracy by 4%.
  • Engineered a high-performance data model for Shopify transactions, optimizing complex joins and indexing to slash report latency by 30% and reduce query size by 25%.
  • Implemented fault-tolerant Python (Scrapy) pipelines with dynamic proxy and user-agent rotation to bypass anti-bot measures across 15+ sources, eliminating 80% of manual data collection.

items.title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Transportation Operations)
items.body:
• Designed a normalized 3NF SQL schema to replace legacy flat-files, implementing strict data validation checks to ensure a robust foundation for real-time Power BI dashboards.
  • Engineered a performance optimization for Bill of Lading (BOL) validation, reducing query runtime by 85% (from 20 minutes to under 3 minutes) via targeted SQL indexing and join restructuring.
  • Automated ETL workflows using Python, SQL, and Azure, saving $50k+ annually in manual processing costs and eliminating human error in financial reporting.
